channel.title: Math question
channel.description:
Hello, I'm making a runescape bot for a 317 client (RSPS). But now I reached the hardest part: math. How can I calculate a players position (xy from the base) to the screen point? See the picture below:
[img]http://i49.tinypic.com/35lf9z4.png[/img]
In this picture you see:
Location: location of a tile in the world. Camera: position of the camera (x curve, y curve) (x position, y position, z position) Local pos: Position in the loaded area
Is it possible with this info to determine to point in screen of my character?
* sorry for my bad english

item.title: Math question
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

This should help you out:

/**
 * RS2Vector
 * @author t4
 */
public final class RS2Vector {
	
	private final int x, y, z;
	
	public RS2Vector(final int x, final int y, final int z) {
		this.x = x;
		this.y = y;
		this.z = z;
	}
	
	public RS2Vector(RS2Vector v) {
		this.x = v.x;
		this.y = v.y;
		this.z = v.z;
	}

	public int getX() {
		return x;
	}

	public int getY() {
		return y;
	}

	public int getZ() {
		return z;
	}
	
	public int getRegionX()	{
		return (x >> 3) - 6;
	}

	public int getRegionY()	{
		return (y >> 3) - 6;
	}
	
	public int getLocalX() {
		return x - 8 * getRegionX();
	}

	public int getLocalY() {
		return y - 8 * getRegionY();
	}
	
	public RS2Vector add(RS2Vector v) {
		return new RS2Vector(this.x + v.x, this.y + v.y, this.z);		
	}
	
	public RS2Vector sub(RS2Vector v) {
		return new RS2Vector(this.x - v.x, this.y - v.y, this.z);		
	}
}
